headline: Postal service plans to open last-mile delivery network to more shippers in money-raising move
summary: The U.S. Postal Service said Wednesday it intends to open its “last-mile” delivery network, the most expensive part of the shipping process, to large and small shippers, expanding beyond current arrangements with giants such as Amazon and UPS.  The postal service expects to accept bids in late January or early February from other shippers, which will propose their own mix of volume, price and delivery timing.  The agency will award contracts later in 2026, based on where it can provide same- and next-day delivery service at a profit.

raw.headline: Postal service plans to open last-mile delivery network to more shippers in money-raising move

The postal service expects to accept bids in late January or early February from other shippers, which will propose their own mix of volume, price and delivery timing.  The agency will award contracts later in 2026, based on where it can provide same- and next-day delivery service at a profit.

headline: UPS Stock Rises After U.S. Postal Service Lifts Limits on Last-Mile Access
summary: UPS shares rose as much as 1.1% Wednesday after the U.S. Postal Service said it is reopening access to its last-mile delivery network.  The postal service move reverses a policy, put in place in 2024 by then-Postmaster General Louis DeJoy, that restricted access to facilities that handled last-mile deliveries.  The idea was to get shippers to funnel more packages into the postal network earlier in the delivery process.

headline: New Ownership of Pak Mail in Austin, Texas Offers Essential Shipping and Office Services to the Community
summary: Annex Brands, Inc., a leading franchisor in the packing, shipping, and office services industries, is pleased to announce the successful transfer of ownership of an existing Pak Mail location in Austin, TX to new owners, Scott Kodak and Chad Wicks. This transition to new ownership ensures that the community will continue to benefit from the 22 years of expert shipping and office services provided by this Pak Mail location.

headline: UPS: 6.5% Dividend, Cost Cuts, And 2026 Earnings Recovery; Reiterate Buy
summary: UPS stock is rated a "Buy" given its attractive valuation, robust 6.5% yield, improved margins, and technical support. Learn more about the shipping company.
